Thanks!

Credits

Programming and Graphics
Sami Viitanen

Testing and Special Thanks
---
Copyright Sami Viitanen 2011, All rights reserved.

Known limitations

* Automatic PIN code handling for devices still missing. Devices with 0000 PIN code should work.

* Support of different tag types depends on your device and version of Android. If you have issues with some tags please include following information to report: What were your device, version of Android and type of tag.

* Tag can be read by any Android 4.1+ phone (with NFC support), or with Android 4.0.x phones which have this application installed.

This application allows you to write Bluetooth connectivity information to NFC tags. These tags can be then used for easy connecting between your Bluetooth devices and Android phone. Connecting and disconnecting happens simply by touching the NFC tag with your device.
NFC does not seem to be enabled. You have to enable it manually. Tap OK to start settings. Return to this application with back after you are done.
Please move your phone close to writable NFC tag. When tag is found, Bluetooth connectivity information will be written to it.
Enable write protection of the tag
Bluetooth enabled to locate Bluetooth devices.
Your device does not support NFC
Be careful! Setting tag read only is irreversible action.
Please enable the pair mode of your Bluetooth device, if your device is not listed here.
No Bluetooth audio devices found. Please check that your Bluetooth devices are turned on, in pairing mode and visible. Then restart the device discovery.
Writing to tag failed.\n\nPlease check that tag is not write protected, and there is enough space for data.
Given tag is too small to contain information needed.
Given tag is unsupported. Try another.
Adds Handover Select record to tag, for better compatibility. Will not fit to smallest tags.
